citeinfo.title: 2 meter Sea Level Rise of Grenville Area

descript.abstract: This is the extent of all dry land in the Grenville pilot site area below 2 meter using the 1 meter LiDAR surface from the filtered LiDAR points using nearest neighbor interpolation. This LiDAR was flown in 2007. The new contour was extracted using map calculator and the area was clipped to the coastline. It is being used to model a 2 meter rise in sea level rise.
descript.purpose: These data were created under the direction of The Nature Conservancy for the Ecosystem Based Adaptation in the Grenadine Bank project (AWE). This project is built on the hypothesis that the neighboring and ecologically connected small island states in the Grenadine Bank can enhance the resilience of people and nature to climate change impacts by protecting, restoring and sustainably managing marine and coastal systems and strengthening community capacity for adaptation.
